Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage fluid, gastric aspirate, tissue biopsies, other body fluids (e.g., pleural fluid, cerebrospinal fluid)
Purpose: To detect acid-fast bacilli in clinical specimens to aid in the diagnosis of tuberculosis and other mycobacterial infections.
Equipment: Light microscope, Bunsen burner or slide warmer, standard laboratory glass slides, wash bottle with distilled water
